title: Here’s how OpenAI uses your data when you use ChatGPT through Apple’s integrations
content:
Following Apple’s integration of OpenAI’s ChatGPT within iOS 18, iPadOS 18, and macOS Sequoia, OpenAI has detailed how your data is handled when you use ChatGPT through Apple’s integration.  You can use ChatGPT through Apple’s integrations without logging into a ChatGPT account, but you get access to additional features if you log into your account. […]

title: Stigg makes it easy to change your SaaS pricing
content:
Stigg (not The Stig, just Stigg) describes itself as “the first scalable monetization platform for the modern billing stack.” There’s a lot going on in that sentence, but what it comes down to is that the startup, which on Wednesday announced a $17.5 million Series A round, helps SaaS companies model pricing, create pricing pages, […]

title: MariaDB spinout SkySQL secures seed funding to ‘bring conversational AI to databases’
content:
Anyone who’s followed the fortunes of MySQL and MariaDB these past 15 years will probably remember SkySQL, another brand that once existed within that same database ecosystem and, a year ago, became a standalone company once more. That company today announced it has raised its first outside funding — a $6.6 million seed round — […]

title: OpenAI 2024 event: How to watch new ChatGPT product reveals and demos
content:
OpenAI is in the holiday spirit, it seems. The ChatGPT series of reveals, called “12 Days of OpenAI,” will be streamed live at 10 a.m. PT each weekday through December 23. title: Russian government spies targeted Ukraine using tools developed by cybercriminals
content:

title: Bid to revive UK privacy damages suit against Google DeepMind fails to show class
content:
Another attempt to get a class-action style privacy damages case to stick against Google has failed in the U.K. after the Court of Appeal refused to overturn an earlier dismissal. The lawsuit concerned the misuse of health records for some 1.6 million patients whose information was passed to Google’s AI division, DeepMind, back in 2015 […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

title: Apple reportedly developing AI server chip with Broadcom
content:
Apple is working with semiconductor company Broadcom on its first server chip designed to handle AI applications, according to The Information, which cited three people with knowledge of the project.  Apple is known for designing its own chips – called Apple Silicon and primarily manufactured by TSMC – for its devices. But those chips weren’t […]

title: 200 VCs wanted to get into Lumen Orbit’s $11M seed round
content:
Lumen Orbit, a startup looking to build data centers in space, was able to close its recent seed round in mere days amid intense investor interest. The Redmond, Washington-based company closed on a $11 million seed round at a $40 million valuation, confirming prior TechCrunch reporting that the company had raised a competitive double-digit round […]

title: Snapchat users can now keep messages in a chat for a week
content:
Snapchat is rolling out a few new features for users and Snapchat+ subscribers for the holiday season, the company announced on Wednesday. The features include expanded chat options, new app themes, and more. Snapchat users now have the option to save their conversations for seven days instead of having them disappear after 24 hours. Snap […]

content:

title: Google unveils Project Mariner: AI agents to use the web for you
content:
Google unveiled its first-ever AI agent that can take actions on the web on Wednesday, a research prototype from the company’s DeepMind division called Project Mariner. The Gemini-powered agent takes control of your Chrome browser, moves the cursor on your screen, clicks buttons, and fills out forms, allowing it to use and navigate websites much […]

title: YC-backed Finny is using AI to match financial advisors with prospects
content:
Financial advisors have a big hurdle when it comes to finding new clients: Cold outreach rarely works. Often, the only way to find a good prospect is to tap your network for warm intros, or trawl platforms like LinkedIn, Pitchbook or ZoomInfo in hopes of landing a meeting, which may or may not convert. Eden […]

title: Reveal Technology raises $11M to scale ‘decision dominance’ tools for DOD
content:
Military operators need to rapidly make decisions in high-stakes environments, but they’re often stuck with technology that’s unable to deliver accurate information about their surroundings. Military leaders have made clear that they’re prioritizing “decision dominance” for troops, but actually shipping new technologies and getting them in the hands of end users can be more challenging.  […]

title: Learn how to use Apple Intelligence’s ‘Image Playground’
content:
